reason:
MISSING ANALYSIS OF 0 < q < 1 REGIME: The node claims 'exponential large-j asymptotics' for ALL fixed q > 0, q != 1, but does not distinguish the qualitatively different behaviors of q > 1 vs 0 < q < 1.

For the quantum dimension [2j+1]_q = (q^{2j+1} - q^{-(2j+1)})/(q - q^{-1}):
- For q > 1: [2j+1]_q ~ q^{2j}/(q - q^{-1}) -> +infinity exponentially.
- For 0 < q < 1: [2j+1]_q = (q^{2j+1} - q^{-(2j+1)})/(q - q^{-1}). Since q - q^{-1} < 0 and q^{2j+1} - q^{-(2j+1)} < 0 (as q^{2j+1} < q^{-(2j+1)} for 0 < q < 1), we get [2j+1]_q > 0 and [2j+1]_q ~ q^{-(2j+1)}/(q^{-1} - q) -> +infinity exponentially.

So the quantum dimension GROWS exponentially for BOTH q > 1 and 0 < q < 1, just with different rates. The node and child 1.3.1 claim Vol_hyp < 0 giving 'exponential decay' for 0 < q < 1, but this needs careful justification because the overall normalization of diagrams (involving products of quantum dimensions in denominators) could compensate. The node does not analyze how the q-dependent vertex normalization (flagged in node 1.1.2) interacts with the exponential 6j growth.
